main event: A naval officer aboard the USS Noble spotted a bright object, similar to a second magnitude star, moving in a southeasterly direction in the Pacific Ocean on October 30, 1961.
interesting points: The object was visible for 11 minutes, disappearing on the horizon at an elevation of 132 degrees.
The object made a slight change of course to the right during the sighting.
Neither air nor surface radar could detect the object.
The elevation of the object was verified using a sextant.
The sighting conformed to the pattern of a satellite, but there was no indication that it was a satellite.
sighted object: a bright object, similar to a second magnitude star
witnesses: naval officer aboard the USS Noble
